alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 9:48AM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR MUCH OF SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY UNTIL 315 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roadways, creeks, and streams are expected. In addition, there will be a significant risk of mud and rockslides, especially on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since last night. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected through early afternoon, highest in the coastal foothills. This additional rain in combination with saturated grounds will result in flooding. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Grover Beach, Santa Margarita, Black Mountain, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Lake Lopez, Shandon, Templeton and Shell Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
